required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-label, Multicenter, Prospective Study of Irreversible Electroporation (Nano Knife) Combined With Radiotherapy and Chemotherapy in Patients With Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multicenter, Prospective Study of Irreversible Electroporation (Nano Knife) Combined With Radiotherapy and Chemotherapy in Patients With Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer

collaborator.agency: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, multicenter, prospective study of irreversible electroporation (nano knife) combined with radiotherapy and chemotherapy in patients with locally advanced pancreatic cancer.

secondary_outcome.description: EOLTC QLQ-C30 (V3.0 Chinese version) was used to evaluate the quality of life (QOL) according to the European Cancer Research and Treatment Organization (EORTC) core quality of life scale

arm_group.description: This project plans to enroll 40 patients receiving nanoknife treatment, our center enrolls 20 patients, and the other two centers will enroll 10 patients each. The number of patients expected to participate in the study is 240.

intervention.description: Patients with locally advanced pancreatic cancer diagnosed by cell / histopathology will receive nano knife treatment if the target lesion is not suitable for surgical resection or the target lesion is suitable for surgical resection but patients give up surgery and choose nano knife combined with chemotherapy. Patients who have not previously received first-line chemotherapy will receive systemic chemotherapy for 4-6 cycles of treatment. Imaging evaluation will be performed every 6-8 weeks (± 7 days) during chemotherapy.

clinical_study.keyword: irreversible electroporation, nano knife, pancreatic cancer.
